issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
in 4.0 create key pair no longer auto downloads the key pair because that is mobile-unfriendly. Instead, it takes you to a second dialog where the key pair can be either downloaded or swiped to cut and paste. When selecting create key pair from the key pairs landing page, the dialog to download the key pair does not display. This works as it should when create key pair is launched from inside the launch instance and create launch configs wizards, but not from the key pairs landing page or the dashboard.

The problem here is that the functionality for creating and downloading key pairs is inconsistent depending on where you launched it from.  

UPDATE: Solution is to remove the intermediary copy-paste dialogs from the create key pair operation on the launch instance and create launch config wizards
fields.summary: Create key pair operations on launch wizards display unnecessary copy-paste key pair dialog

comments.body: [~jloza], I just tested the same on 10.111.5.53 and 10.111.1.110 on FF 29. The key downloaded as expected.

[~jloza]: I tested on Safari 6.1.3 and Chrome 34.0.1847.131 (on Mac OS 10.8.5) and was able to create a key pair (clicking Create Key Pair link on landing page), with the private key downloading just fine on my machine.  The intermediate copy-keypair dialog doesn't display on the create key pair page, but I don't think we ever displayed the dialog on the create key pair page.

OK, I doublechecked my downloads box on FF and the keys were in fact downloaded, but I was never given any indication this had happened. This is inconsistent with behavior in other places where we create keys, we should be consistent everywhere or users will get confused.

We can talk about the other places we download things for 4.0.1 or 4.1, but for now we should at least make the key pair functionality consistent.
[~jloza]: I'm seeing a browser download confirmation dialog in Firefox. See screenshot

The issue here is that the behavior of "Create keypair"  action does not match when called from Dashbord and landing page, versus being called from Launch instance wizard. See the two attached screenshots.

Since keypairs can be created and downloaded in both cases, this issue is not a blocker. It is also not critical for the 4.0.0 release. 

Because of the regression potential, we should fix this in 4.0.1.
Let's see what it would take to fix it and then assess the regression potential. Could be small?

I just tested the same with 3.4.2 console. The behavior of  "Create keypair" called from the landing page in 3.4.2 completely matches the behavior of  "Create keypair" called from the landing page in 4.0.0
[~alice] that's correct. The new extra dialog was added in 4.0, did not exist in 3.4.x
Although the fix is non-trivial, the regression potential is minimal.

This bug is critical from a UX standpoint (updated from blocker to critical now that I know the download functionality at least is working). Inconsistent behavior is very bad for users. 

Since the fix has minimal regression potential I very much would like to fix this for 4.0.

Please keep in mind, that even if the fix itself is 100% safe, there
is always a chance that it will expose some new bugs that stayed
hidden. 

It would be great to fix it in 4.0.1

The changes are completely isolated to the create key pair page.  It does not modify or affect the key pairs landing page or the launch wizards or the dashboard.  The chance that new bugs will be exposed is minimal IMO.
I'm OK with getting this fix in in 4.0 as long as we all test it out very thoroughly, which I know we will.
YAY ALICE IS MY BEST FRIEND
[~jloza] to QA this once it's ready.

[~alice], [~jloza], [~viglesias] Heads up that implementing GUI-980 will require the following selenium tests to be updated

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/develop/tests/selenium/KOALA/create-key-pair-from-dashboard-and-delete.html
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/develop/tests/selenium/KOALA/create-key-pair-from-dashboard.html
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/develop/tests/selenium/KOALA/create-key-pair-from-landing-page.html
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/develop/tests/selenium/KOALA/create-key-pair-key_1-from-dashboard.html
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/develop/tests/selenium/KOALA/create-key-pair-key_2-from-landing-page.html

Please advise on whether or not to proceed with this for 4.0
This is getting to be much too big of a fix. Let's push this out, we are planning on getting rid of the copy-paste dialog in a future release anyway...
[~alice] [~viglesias] [~tjcramer]: pushing this bug out of 4.0, it turned into too much dev work and larger regression potential than initially thought.

Next steps on this are for [~kgill] to confirm if relatively recent mobile devices handle file downloads properly (which they should).  If so, we can remove the copy-pasta dialog and simply download the key file to the user agent when created.

Testing on HTC One M8, running Android 4.4.3:
The create key pair operation in the launch instance wizard allows the key pair to be downloaded to the device, with a notification that the file download succeeded.  The key file cannot be opened on the device (since Android doesn't know how to handle .pem files), but the file can be sent via email (or added to Dropbox, etc.) using the "Downloads" app on the device.

Going to test on iOS next...

On iOS 7.1 (using the iOS simulator), I receive the following error when clicking the "Download Key Pair" button after creating a key pair in the Launch Instance wizard

{code}
Safari could not install a profile due to an unknown error
{code}

I also tested with an actual iPhone 4S device running iOS 6.1, and an iPad running iOS 6.0, which also return the above error.

References:
https://discussions.apple.com/thread/6054747?tstart=0

[~jloza]: Looks as though iOS is unable to handle file downloads initiated from Web apps, so we may need to add the copy-paste dialog when creating key pairs outside the launch wizards.

We should discuss the UX implications before we implement the intermediary dialogs there, since introducing the intermediary dialog for the the key file download would require an explicit click of the "Download Key Pair" button.  The concern here is that if the copy-paste dialog is mistakenly closed, the user will potentially lose the ability to download the key pair, a drawback that may outweigh the benefit of supporting key file downloads on iOS devices.  Thoughts?

[~kgill], agreed, the UX implications were what bothered me about having the intermediate dialog to begin with. I would vote for removing it entirely, everywhere, and only supporting key pair download on non-mobile devices for now. That's the far more likely use case for accessing the VMs anyway.
[~jloza]: I've updated the title of this ticket to better reflect what the true issue is here based on our recent comment thread.
Pull request at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1142

Works perfect, [~kgill]! 

One thing: The submit button should be "button expand" class...I tried to do it myself but got hung up on the div row stuff which seemed like the wrong class for the div and then I thought I would just back away slowly and let you fix this instead of trying to push something wrong.
Pushed a fix in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/9adb79294f83e6648434a17fdd3cb5ee1868ecf1 to expand the submit button in the create key pair dialog, ready for UX review.
UX review passed, ready for code review.
small bug noted in PR.
PR updated with typo fix.  Thanks to you and [~kyolee] for catching that!
